Reading through material and in the chat with Facebook PM, saw this blurb: "Given that we are going to introduce Care Assistant for 1:1 help, it may eventually make sense to allow “Carrie” into your other conversations to help out but we may not want to lead with that until the other context is established"
<@U0ML49XU0> Do you have any further context around this idea of what 1:1 help means?
No additional context but what I take it to mean is
Initial launch of Assistan tis a direct resource for me or you
future iteration would be an intermediate in my conversation _with_ you
out of pocket until noon thirty or oneish, people. i sent semio questions to dennis. looking forward to learning more about today's session.

Also, heads up client kick off is getting moved to first thing Monday AM, will be a bit early.And for that I apologize but client is East Coast Time and they want to bring the CTO, DK (main stakeholder)
<https://venturebeat.com/2016/12/21/8-top-chatbots-of-2016/>

attachments.title: The 8 best chatbots of 2016
attachments.text: Wow, what a year! More than 34,000 bots have been built since Facebook Messenger opened its platform to bot developers back in April. Thousands more are probably being designed by inspired teams across the globe as I write these lines. Saying these numbers are mind-blowing would be an understatement. The tech industry's enthusiasm for the bot space is simply unprecedented. Obviously, there have been a fair number of "fart bots" goofs -- after all, we're all trying to figure out the space and tinkering is the best way to do so -- but it's been interesting to witness the plethora of new ideas and business models emerging from the early trial-and-error days.

text: question for folks. what do we know about due diligence at <http://care.com|care.com>? just a quick google search reveals there's been some weirdness (as there is wont to be). anybody? this is relevant for voice.
hey <@U4VTSDW7P> can I ask ya to go a level deeper? Not sure I follow.

So Elise and I were just talking and I thought the group would benefit from this exchange. I’m taken editorial liberties with the chat :slightly_smiling_face:

Q: And I do understand that a big portion of the ask is about the persona/style of the assistant. That seems intrinsically linked to the 3.0 work which seems like will be finalized _after_ we finish our 5 weeks. So I am curious, because of this timeline, if our work will inform theirs?

A: Yes, 100%. Not only does it inform 3.0 work but also the tone and voice of current 2.0 platform. It’s kind of the Anthropomorphisization of 2.0

 Q: Still unclear about what problem we are solving with the  assistant and what it means to design for one "scenario"

A: Me too! Part of the scope is, out of all the questions, pinpoints, insights we (+ client) identify (like in our Semiosession) we must choose one, gain consensus and lay out a strategic plan for how the bot can combat this.  v1.0 of bot can’t do much of anything, let alone anything, but what can it do to help?

*I don’t know the answer here, no one does. Help us get there.*

<@U0ML49XU0> I've been thinking about voice and content. we know that the seeker, for example--beyond "help"--is looking for connection, experience, dependability...even love. but where is "trust and safety" prioritized on this list? and, to that point, what does <http://care.com|care.com> do to ensure that the relationships they broker are safe? do they do background checks, for example?

totally hear ya now.  that's a great question. i know, anecdotally, that they provide background checks as a service but I'm wondering if <@U0HP6TFNX> or <@U0GN0A9EV> has any deeper insight? I honestly don't know that it's prioritized very high
we have a good deal of info on the role of safety / legal
background checks are a service they offer, and are one of many recommended safety steps, but are highly misunderstood in terms of their scope and comprehensiveness

for liability reasons they moved away from marketing this service upfront, but the majority of the brand loyalty to this day comes from people having a misconception that care has vetted the safety and background of caregivers
I can give you way more detail than that if you think it would be useful
we actually were asked NOT to take notes on the subject because of the sensitivity of the issue, otherwise I'd share more details than that
thanks <@U0ML49XU0> and <@U0HP6TFNX>
